div.l: Agayn my loos y wol have esement
By goddes soule it shal non other be
Þis Iohn answered aleyn avyse the
Þe Miller is a ꝑperalous man he seide
And yf þat he oute of his slep abraydeabraydabrayde
He myght don vs both a vylanye
Aleyn aıı̄unswered y count him not a flye
And vp he rist and by þe wenche he crepte
Þis wench lay vp right and fast slepte
Til he so nygh was er sho myght espye
Þat it hedde byn to late for to crye
And shortly for to seyn þey were at home
Now pley · Aleyn for y wol speke of Iohn
Þis Iohn lyeth stille a furlong wey or two
And to him selfe he maketh rowth and wo
Allas qduod he þis is a wikked Iape
Now may y seyn þat I am but an Ape
Yet hath my felow sumwhat for his harme
He hath þe Millers doughter in his Arme
He auntered him he has his nodes spedde
And I lye as adraf sak in my bedde
And whan þis Iape is tolde another day
I shal be holden a draf a Cokeney
I wol a ryse and auntre it by my feyth
Vnhardy is vnsely thus men seith
And vp he roos and softely he went
Vnto þe cradel and in his honde hit hent
And bar hit softe vnto his beddes feet
Sone after þis þe wif hir rowtyng let
And gan awake and went hir oute to pisse
And cam a gayn̄ and gan hir credel misse
And groped her and ther but she founde noon̄
Allas qduod she I hedde almost mysgon̄
I hedde almost gon to þe clerkys bedde
Ey benedicite þan hadde I foule yspedde
And forth sho goth til sho þe Cradel founde
She graspeth al wey further with hir honde
And found þe bed and þought noght but gode
By cause þat þe Cradel by hit stod
And nest where she was for hit was derke
